bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 194 (Monday, November 16, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. HUDSON:H.R. 8752.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8=========================== NOTE ===========================November 16, 2020, on page H5796, middle of the second column,the following appeared: By Mr. Hudson H.R. 8762.The online version has been corrected to read: By Mr. Hudson H.R. 8752.========================= END NOTE =========================[Page H5796]

item.title: To authorize the National Medal of Honor Museum Foundation to establish a commemorative work in the District of Columbia or its environs, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

item.title: National Medal of Honor Monument Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources by unanimous consent.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
National Medal of Honor Monument Act

This bill authorizes the National Medal of Honor Museum Foundation to establish a commemorative work on federal land in the District of Columbia in honor of the extraordinary acts of valor, selfless service, and sacrifice displayed by Medal of Honor recipients.

The foundation shall be solely responsible for the acceptance of contributions for, and the payment of expenses of, the establishment of the commemorative work.

Federal funds may not be used to pay any expenses for the establishment of the commemorative work.

bill.title: National Medal of Honor Monument Act

item.title: National Medal of Honor Monument Act
National Medal of Honor Monument Act
To authorize the National Medal of Honor Museum Foundation to establish a commemorative work in the District of Columbia and its environs, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
